name: Simple 2D Problem
description: Baseline 2-variable model that pairs perfectly with the 2D visualizer.
context: Maximize the profit of two complementary products subject to two shared resources.

name: Production Planning
description: Factory-style planning with labor, machine and demand constraints.
context: Two products compete for labor and machine time; product A also has a demand cap.

name: Resource Allocation
description: Allocate scarce resources between two activities with a balance constraint.
context: Balance profitability with fairness by enforcing an offset between variables.

name: Diet Problem
description: Nutrition-inspired variant framed as a maximization challenge.
context: Select food items to hit nutrition targets while staying within budget.

name: Tight Constraints
description: Shows how multiple constraints can bind simultaneously at optimum.
context: Uniform objective makes it easy to inspect complementary slackness.

name: Corner Point Example
description: Demonstrates how the optimal point sits at a polygon vertex.
context: Visualize iso-profit lines gliding across the feasible polygon.

name: Phase-One Feasibility Kickoff
description: Equality and ≥ constraints that force a two-phase start.
context: Use this model to discuss why Phase I introduces artificials: the equality and ≥ constraint break the default identity basis, so the solver builds feasibility before optimizing.
insights: Perfect for walking through Phase I tableau construction
Highlights how ≥ constraints convert to surplus + artificial variables

name: Duality Bridge Problem
description: Compact primal whose shadow prices map cleanly to the dual solution.
context: Pairs naturally with a dual-derivation exercise: every constraint becomes a dual variable and the RHS/S shadow prices align perfectly for classroom walkthroughs.
insights: Shadow prices equal the dual variable values shown on the Analysis page
Great springboard for explaining strong duality and complementary slackness
